you need a transistor that will oscillate up to at least 1ghz-preferably up to 8ghz.  mrf901 or mrf571hook it up as a regenerative detector.  even simpler, take a center tapped 12 volt power transformer.  hook positive of aa battery to center. negative to emitter of transistor. collector to either remaining tap on transformer.  i megohm rheostat/potentiometer to other lug of transformer in series to base of transistor. capacitatively couple hv side of transformer to input of audio amp.  you can get some effect with 2n222 transistor from radio shack.  adjust rheostat till you just begin to hear faint high pitched tone then add 6 ft of wire to base for antenna. move wires around till radio voices get loud.  at that point it will be squegging (superregenerative)  rfparts.com has mrf901 transistors
   
  at some point of adjustment , multiple radio voices turn to something much much different.  you will KNOW. just let it run. its ok to turnit off but dont move it from room to room.
   
  the only way to make it cover a whole neighborhood is to drive a ground rod about 6ft into ground and you need a slightly elevated antenna of some kind which can be indoors. the ground rod must be in the ground and not a water pipe although -for reasons i cant figure out, the shut off valve down low next to the toilet on ground floor will work.  just clamp ground to that (dont put antenna where kightning will zap toilet though;  very embarrassing way to depart the material world.}
